intro: Viguiera latibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Viguiera latibracteata is known for its ability to thrive in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. Its flowers bloom in late summer and early fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
